vwgWwKbtuDZFlnQDy1dLxA.text: Ate there twice...first time sushi was very good, seaweed salad portion very very small.  Yesterday ate Teriyaki salmon, portion was ridiculously small less than 2 oz of fish including skin for $16.  Normal restaurant portions anywhere else are minimum 4-6 oz. cooked food just ok. Service could be much improved.

Z0epwJ1esID3O2BGxkQBfA.text: I use to go to the one in south park pretty often. So glad this location opened up just recently.  The quality is consistent like the one in south park. The restaurant is beautiful and very open.  I love the whole restaurant is all windows basically.  Nice place to have dinner with great ambience.

NsjlF780euvuyiqtP9vobQ.text: First time eating sushi after leaving San Francisco for Charlotte that we weren't disappointed. Great service, strong prep, quality fish, and interesting rolls and bowls, at reasonable prices - especially for lunch. We've been back several times and will be again.

Ouv4JEtXvl42WRCWg0CRGg.text: We went to YAMA for the first time today for lunch and really loved it!  The atmosphere is great, the service was very nice and the food was delicious!  I had the chicken teriyaki bento box(A) with fried rice, and my husband had a sushi bento box (B).  They both came with miso soup to start, and it was so delicate and flavorful, with the teeeeniest cute mushrooms in it. Our waitress (pronounced "Hat") offered to refill our bowls, and I was tempted, but knew I had plenty of food coming. Both boxes had a salad with ginger dressing, and mine had two gyoza and sauce and sauteed veggies under the chicken.  The fried rice tasted a little different from any I've had - in a good way!  We look forward to going back and trying more interesting things!

zmnqXKACYecfLILKcdmGcw.text: So excited that Yama has a location closer to home! Visited during their soft opening and love the new space! Excellent service, food tastes delicious (just like all of their other locations). We sampled a sweet, bubbly Sake called Mio that was awesome. And I honestly have tried Sake and it was always too strong. This was perfect. All of staff worked together to make us feel welcome and at home. The kids loved the chicken and salmon teriyaki dishes, so it is a great place for families. Beautiful presentation for the dishes. Great Friday night in Waverly.

tr8nB9lHVD7axujz9pq-AA.text: The sushi was amazing. I asked for salmon belly which I didn't see on the menu (so I don't know if it on there but they sure did cut me a great couple of pieces) yes the parking is bad but it's a huge parking with like 8 other restaurants, so expect a crowd. The wait wasn't bad but I went crazy early (like K&W cafeteria early). We got a sushi for 2 platter and everything was fresh and presentation was on point.

BxAfn39cERCw7TF11yWGUw.text: We had dinner at Yama last night. Because this location is new and that we didn't have reservations it was a fairly long wait. However, they made up for it in the food and service. I've never seen a more attentive staff all working together to give you a great experience. Our server was Jennifer and she was great. The food was excellent. All high quality Asian food without breaking the bank. I had the Udon noodles with shrimp while hubby and daughter had the teriyaki steak. We loved the atmosphere. Great place for drinks too. Will definitely go back again.

qP-FT3UM9K6MasQjZ1ySgQ.text: Great quality! I hang out with friends had dinner in here. We ordered different kind of sushi. All the taste are good. The service is not familiar with that, this is the only thing i think they have to approve. Overall, it's a good sushi place.

6mJr3N1b7Nkr2GiMWtBSgA.text: Excellent service.   Specialty roll options were varied but not too overwhelming you can't decide.   We tried a Naughty Akami and Morrison rolls.  Both were excellent.  Akami has a little bit of spice and was my favorite.  The Morrison I always like the mix of filet and was my friends favorite.   Service was excellent and menu described well. The rolls were on the small side however.  Noticeably smaller than most sushi restaurants.  Great addition to neighborhood.

CWWxLEQlWN9IEgF8ckcRaA.text: Simply outstanding. Incredibly beautiful inside, with fabulously fresh sushi selections, amazing service, amazing Sake and wine, and some of the best Japanese curry and other traditional favorites I've had outside of Japan. Highly recommend it!!!!!

thRKjTBw8Oloo4Hjx6zTgw.text: OMG!!!!!  This place puts Nobu to shame.  Amazing sushi, just amazing.  Excellent service.  By far, top sushi restaurant I've ever been to in the US

jEgf14LFgtYN4mrj4eSU5g.text: Nothing like going to a sushi bar that has top of the line offerings - Oh Toro, Chu Toro, Inada, Aji - this is  a melt in your mouth experience. Also had the duck & it was delicious - tender, slightly smoky. Love the service here.  Can't wait 2 try more.

xJ_IUjp4Fnw6f8DmKL2POA.text: Great sushi, great drinks, and the staff was great! This will be my new place to get sushi, it was really fresh! I also loved the ambience and the decor. I am so glad I decided to try an different sushi place!

bVORL3ZPJ-PKdmucHeFUtw.text: I have been here a couple of times but never sat at the bar. Our bartender was not attentive and was almost rude when answering a question we had. Some of our food came on time and some I had to get to go. Only then did the bartender show any concern for the delay. I know it was not her fault (I'm assuming slow kitchen), but the others were done with dinner before I finally asked for it to go. She did offer to comp that entree but we paid anyway. I mean I did get the food. Although, it was not great leftover. Oh well. $100 lesson learned.

V8v3ixsY1ZIB8n56iaxdmQ.text: Just finished dinner there and I'm very impressed with this new place ! The decorations inside are very contemporary and well designed. Super busy tonight when we got there due to their new opening and i guess also cause it's weekend! We started with tempura vegetables, calamari and shumai and an eel hand roll! they are all super yummy ! For entree we had teriyaki salmon and chicken Yaki udon! The food all nicely plated and prepared ! Even they are really busy but food still come out in reasonable time ! Our server is Brandon he is super accommodating and nice! We finish with an ice cream sandwich dessert ! Will definitely recommend to friends and family to come try this nice new place !

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

CVAXjn67JOIwoeGn6qYhWw.text: Just had sushi at the restaurant and it was perfect, each piece was explained to me by the sever, the nigiri was perfect size and rice was delicious, and the tekamaki roll was fantastic. Loved the food, and will be going again.

NywgWx2XYk-GE8mEs4ejOg.text: Went to the Yama in Waverly for a ladies night. I had the teriyaki shrimp. It was fantastic! They were out of the wine I selected, but my second choice was more than fine. Will be returning.

tSC34Z7ZHfzqnY50lNFOvw.text: Really liked this place. Service was great, the food was awesome.  We tried the teriyaki shrimp, shrimp tempura roll and the crunch roll all were really good! Highly recommend for sure!

4MCMNYQTh2yjV7GayWQhJg.text: Finally there is a decent sushi restaurant in this area. It's not often I find a place with amazing rolls and food that my kids can eat. We got the magic, lobster and naughty rolls and they were amazing! My kids had udon noodles and teriyaki chicken. The servers were so helpful and friendly. We will definitely be back!

xfOeBbSt80o4jnCubtgN2Q.text: It's a bit over prized but the food and service are Amazing I've been there 3 times and I love it

JNrQxd4Dkdlmg1-oq92S7g.text: I love this sushi spot. Great food and atmosphere. Sushi menu is a little short but nice.

Cr5cYrwX1FgMW3ZxOud0cQ.text: Called in today Tuesday March 20th for a reservation this coming Saturday for a party of 12.  A very nice young lady said sure no problem, what time? I asked for 7:30 and she said not a problem. I then asked if they had a private room. She confirmed they do but wasn't sure it could hold 12. She put me on hold to find out. Then a very rude guy got on the line and with attitude said that room only hold 10 plus it's already taken. I said no worries we will just take a table. He then replied not at 7:30 that is prime time and we would have to move tables for your group. He asked if we could just come in on Sunday. What a jerk. He then replied well if your group would come in at 6 and could be done for prime time around 7:30 he might be able to assist our group. I will never be back and hopefully management lets him go on Sunday. Yama in Waverly- Charlotte NC

x5ya1X76ZpIiLu47tndvEA.text: Great outdoor seating! Our Server Brandon was awesome! Recommended a great Japanese beer with buddha bottle. He said we could take the bottle home and I forgot it! Great service!

LI5yIDniNAWAWNlX32qcdQ.text: We opted for Yama on a Friday night at 6pm!  There was no seating available except at the sushi bar. Was great! We watched the sushi being prepared. We ordered the crunchy roll, the Morrison roll, spider roll, and the Ballantine roll.  All were so delicious and we topped it all off with a Sapporo beer.  This is now my favorite sushi place!  Got the Mochi for dessert! Awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

c15mJNqrvmGo-okyR1vniA.text: Best sushi in South Charlotte. Upscale atmosphere without feeling stuffy, indoor/outdoor seating along with a bar and sushi bar. We needed a place like this in Waverly-don't you guys agree?

klvCDkWjNYii3wFVzvqW5Q.text: Our sushi was SUPER fresh - like melt in your mouth fresh. We really enjoyed date night here a few weeks ago sans baby!  It was casual enough to bring baby along if we need to - highly recommend!

zKs9EmIjS2x6rURFVEo6OA.text: YAMA has become our favorite spot in Charlotte.  I have never written a review before, but they are worth it.  The wait staff are friendly and service is as good the food.  I go fairly often and have had all of their wait staff at one time or another.  They almost always come by and greet us whether we are their table or not.  The chefs are just as attentive.       The sashimi is always fresh and has no fishy smell or taste.  They are sure to let you know if they have any specials.  Try the fatty tuna.  It will melt in your mouth.  Be sure to ask for recommendations.  They have a large selection of sashimi and quite a few that others may not.       Give them a shot and you will not be disappointed.  Your service will be spectacular, the food fresh and well prepared.  You will want reservations on Friday and Saturday nights.

ZfR2J2QXoxlKXp2K9zetog.text: Waitress service was good. Hostess service was terrible. Went there and asked for a different table was not accommodated and the hostess said this table was it. We are so busy on weekends. Btw, there are other tables open.  Five minutes later, a different hostess said they have a different table. Everything is about message delivery. You don't say this table was our only option. If you are in the service business you need to be at least make it sound like you are trying to work with you and accommodate.  Will not go back. There are other Japanese restaurants better than this.

d8rQPpH2A8ay-RzJFe-hNw.text: We did not eat here. While we were waiting to be seated, we discovered that the health rating was 91.  We absolutely do not eat in restaurants with low health ratings.  Very disappointing for us - we were looking forward to trying Yama (would have been our first dining experience there).

Py7aHnzVD61Wlik9zk6p-g.text: My new favorite spot for sushi and delicious Japanese cuisine, fresh and tasty food I really enjoyed the Catsu Chicken, simple breaded chicken with a tasty Curry sauce to dip and white rice, the shrimp tempura was also very good. This place is new in Waverly, I will definitely go back and try more of their menu. Service was attentive and quick, expect long waits on Friday & Saturday and congested parking, Waverly Park it's crazy packed almost every day. You can order take out and the portions are pretty decent, I was informed by the hostess that they will add pick up parking spaces.   I personally think the bar attendant could be a bit more attentive, we waited for a while just to make some eye contact for an order and the bar wasn't busy at at all, we did get to order but we never made eye contact ha ha, too busy cleaning and multitasking no big deal really. Man  I want to be a bar attendant just to talk to people and have a good time  people tip well when they feel welcomed, just saying.

5FmZ7HxlG6hY0F_7m4ho8Q.text: We visited on a busier night and still the wait staff was excellent, we got food quickly after ordering, management was kind enough to stop by our table and make sure we were enjoying our food. Most importantly food was made perfectly and was delicious.

yhMjLpgEJ_JQ2uJe3orX5g.text: This was the second time I ate here in a two week period. I ate there this last Tuesday for lunch and ordered the bento box. The food was very good with delicious soup, fresh fish, nice salad and maki roll. The waiter was fast, friendly yet never intrusive. Looking forward to returning. Nice open atmosphere in the restaurant.

joiPU8VfT9lJGsFIjd50og.text: As with their family of other restaurants, this restaurant is a welcome addition to the Restaurant Scene in the Ballantyne market. Speciality rolls and food usually only found in larger cities.  Thank you for opening up close to home!

h0x3HL3C_fK_S1BGK8da6Q.text: Great sushi! Very fresh. Loved the tempura items as well. Parking is an issue, but that's True for most of Waverly complex.

v6saUCOXUis-Ny04oUd7LQ.text: This place is ok. Ambience is very nice and upscale. Stopped for lunch today, ordered sushi. Disappointed on how tiny the sushi sizes were. You have to order at least 2-3 for a normal adult to feel pretty satisfied.  I think there are better sushi places to go to if you are hungry.

zRQGWV8Dx9c1A_w8GUoE8A.text: Best HM roll.  I've had them in Southpark and here at Waverly.  Quality is consistent and closer to home.

40v5mKon84ZDAOX1x3R4qg.text: Excellent food in a new development outside of Charlotte ... the sushi is top shelf and the service is wonderful - great job yama - I will be back... especially for the Morrison and magic roles!

NU1mG8qVBYgoZFiQ01wflw.text: This is a beautiful restaurant. Had lunch there today and the sushi was extremely fresh. Some tables around us ordered their lunchtime bento box which looked yummy. The wait staff was terrific. I will go back again for lunch and dinner

wmWWK7sWwIvFfUvijUEUfw.text: If I could give less than 1 star, I would. Hour wait for food, table not ready even though we were told it was, and to top it all off, food poisoning. Tonight was supposed to be a nice date night where my girlfriend was going to try sushi for the first time. Unfortunately rather than sitting down for a delicious meal, we were served a dish of being stuck in the bathroom for hours on end. We did notice something tasted slightly off and we notified our waiter who then took it off our bill. However, this did not justify the horrific experience we had to endure afterwards. If you want a fresher-tasting, better prepared, and better presented sushi dish, there's no need to look further than your local Harris Teeter.

VG5LkYI6zsTP8WaA9J-UDQ.text: Good sushi in the Waverly area.  The service has been good.  Their main dishes are prepared well also.

s788_NXUgbyn1FLH67iPYQ.text: If the sushi were all we had then this would be getting a solid 5 rating. We had other items that weren't so great. Had the hibachi chicken and the rice on each plate for our party was not really good at all. We will try again as I'm hoping we just got a bad batch. Service was good too. No issues there. Parking was tough even though it looks like there's plenty of space.

d-wO_fgaq40_wzaU8cvGPw.text: This place is amazing. This is best sushi I have ever eaten even compared to the sushi I've had in Asia.  The staff was great. They explained everything to us. Very knowledgeable. Can't wait to come back!

XOVkEa11fXg4ukCekgMaog.text: Love the sushi and Nigiri plate here! The fish is so fresh and certainly up to par. My favorite go to for raw fish. If you're not a raw fish person, they do have other options which is nice (my mom gets shrimp udon noodles). Nice area too! Highly recommend!

7SgITTeAIpp-tn680v6bSw.text: This restaurant never disappoints. The drinks are always GREAT, the food is delicious and the service is always pleasant and consistent. Cool atmosphere!!!

488pU__dwU0zgqx4BnMorw.text: Sushi was just ok and very overpriced for the quality. Service was slow and poor. Their other location is better. Trying too hard to be a trendy restaurant and fail to get the basics right. Co around the corner, Asian fusion, is a better option.  PS - note the 5 star ratings are all spiked from a "soft opening" likely for friends and family.

PsYo4fhVndNilNO83KgDiA.text: This is one of the best restaurants around. Nice and clean environment and the food is amazing. The waitress was great and never missed a beat!

y9-TTZ7M76-Rt4nI1MdRig.text: Two stars for service. It took them at least 3 minutes to acknowledge me at the hostess stand. When they finally sat me I was never greeted. I left after 7 minutes.  It seems that a new restaurant would really be trying to impress. But not these folks.

Q-TGYLswFG6tQjZQtv7jgQ.text: Really good food kinda expensive. The service was not the fastest but was not bad. Overall if you have cash to spend and like Japanese food it's a good place.

eBxpteyIpY42wXFTqwayyQ.text: Ordered sushi platter for 2, great value for money. Included Chu toro. Great ambiance as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

CPMI4XbPAF5gKTosyV4AQA.text: This place is our local go to for Asian food. My husband loves the sushi.  Nice for a date night.  It's not a huge restaurant but had a cute bar area and seating area.  Our food is always cooked to perfection and presented well. Thank you Yama!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken teriyaki with fried rice.  Delish!
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

OjJSLaVcgbwE5rFgB8nLFg.text: My wife and I have a real love for sushi and have eaten it in some wonderful places.  So we know what is good and what is not.  The sushi (that I had) and sashimi that she had was quite good.  Not the best that we have ever had though.  But when the bill came and it was almost $200 for the two of us... I was shocked!  That's more than we have ever spent for Japanese food; and to top it off, I walked out still hungry!!!  We won't be going back

fUJRBNvRF82JEUCDWT_g_Q.text: From the moment we were seated began the horrible experience. Took 10 minutes and me asking the manager if we even had a server to get our drinks ordered. After that, we ordered an appetizer and our food at the same time. Our food came out and by the time we were finished and ready for the check the appetizer still had not come out. We told them not to even bother with it at this point. $50 meal that was not anywhere near worth that price. The experience was really bad even though the food did taste good. Won't be coming back anytime soon.

-alyWYerOBpizACyijmmOw.text: Congratulations a fusion restaurant that gets it.  Sushi (it has a side of pickled ginger- yum!)is a work of tasty art.  Generous portions priced right even for South Charlotte.  Treat yourself to a bowl of onion soup.  Very busy make sure you make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chic
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crunchy Roll

5UVhIdyXgruEeCfEOhJoQA.text: Seriously good spot for sushi. Would recommend the Shumi on the app menu. Really good

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

N7-HUfE8aQKOg_2azCNOcA.text: My wife and I stopped in for lunch on Saturday and we had a very nice meal.  Everything was fresh and there waverly roll was fantastic.  My wife had miso soup and she said it was one of the best she ever had.  We will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

uz2NpPVHykMMK0MQfpiMlQ.text: Must try Waverly roll- excellent!  Shared the teriyaki chicken and shrimp dish- enough shared and left over. Vegetables were fresh and crunchy.  New favorite place!  Great service too!

fWDZz-Q_tW32VpnvezpxDg.text: This is the story of the best sushi I've ever had. Firstly, what a beautiful restaurant. We were seated at the sushi bar at our request.. to oogle the amazing visions of fish. There we could see everything coming out- each more beautiful than the next! We saw the avacado piled with tuna and had to try it. That is when we realized, the tuna and avacado had the same texture. We went for a full plate of sashimi.. this is how to do it. I've never had better fish in all my travels. It all the most beautiful consistency, like butter. I can only hope to go back as soon as possible. Who wants to join me???

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

cHPZG70JV_VI7BUDHD4qxw.text: This is gonna be my go-to sushi in the South Charlotte area. The service is absolutely amazing & the environment is relaxing and friendly. Everyone is super attentive. I got the chance to try a little bit of everything but here are some of my favorites: Crunchy roll (shrimp tempura w/ crab layer on top) & Morrison roll (shrimp tempura w/ seared filet on top), Teriyaki Chicken (chicken is cooked almost crispy and it's absolutely perfect) w/ fried rice, and their Brussels sprouts, which are to die for! Even if you don't like Brussels sprouts, I recommend them. Absolutely delicious! I'll be back again to try some new dishes for sure.

PUMm9R_PJ43GkykQkI9mUg.text: Yet another amazing, art filled delicious meal at Yama......The staff is great, the music is perfect and the attention to detail is second to none.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sampler nigiri. Nice to taste fish we&#39;ve never tried. everything was so fresh and delicious. Wasn&#39;t afraid to try something new.
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

sUNG8w0Nar_2yvZscxM43g.text: Ordered a couple of sushi rolls over the phone, was told that it would be 25 minutes... walked in 35 minutes later and waited 20 minutes for me food to be ready. Really? For a couple of sushi rolls? I asked for a discount because of the inconvience, they wouldn't give me one. Terrible service. I live right near this place and was planning to go a bunch because of the convinence- will not be going back.

w13NrVJhBiNZsgJKbz7OPQ.text: Would have loved to give this place a better review. We really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere, but our service was inattentive and slow. Had to flag 3 different people down for refills on drinks, napkins, to order desert, and finally after watching our server stand at the sushi bar for 15 minutes while we were waiting for our check I had enough. No table awareness whatsoever . To the point I almost said something to the manager but chose to reflect my feelings in the tip (flat 10%). I hate to do that because I was in the restaurant business for 15+ years, but get a clue dude.   When you're paying $250.00+ for a table of 4, you better step it up. I'll go back, but was not a great first impression.

8_Kzj9lPDX-brc5aJBthIQ.text: This is my favorite place to get sushi or teriyaki by far. The service has been amazing every time I've been there. Every waiter is very knowledgeable and gives great recommendations. They have a large assortment of fresh fish and the quality of food is amazing. Some of my favorites are: the platter for 2, the magic roll, the teriyaki chiken (I usually don't like chiken but this is super flavorful and light and crispy), the nigiri assortment, California roll, yaki udon, green tea cheesecake, and their lunch bento boxes. I love everything I try there!

9tZ9YP0lAZlbcNkR_6t17A.text: Excellent sushi and service! Jin was knowledgeable, pleasant and the chefs were phenomenal and friendly! Would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

o25KCYG0PmRX2Hac047ymQ.text: First time to Yama. I said I wanted to have a glass of wine and take out sushi. The hostess pointed me to the bar (right beside the host station) and said they could take care of me. But there were no seats at the bar (which she could have seen if she looked.) I came back to the host station and one of the other hosts, noting my confusion, escorted me to the sushi bar. Once I got there - smooth sailing!   One of the sushi chefs immediately greeted me and a server also greeted me and helped me with the menu. While I was perusing the menu, the server showed me the list of special fish available - all sounded marvelous. I decided on The Waverly, from the menu, which involved salmon and tempura shrimp. While I enjoyed my glass of wine waiting on my order, the sushi chef handed me a complimentary portion of lovely salmon nigiri since I was new to Yama.   Shortly thereafter, the server brought me my take out order. All in all it was a nice visit. I will say however that when one takes out sushi, one loses a major part of the sushi experience. Opening a plastic clam-shell container to find the pieces of sushi more or less crammed inside is just not the same as enjoying the appearance of a lovely plate in the restaurant. But again - my decision!

MhNOk1iiCOIZNwkBa8DTXg.text: Great Japanese style teriyaki food! I had the gyoza dumplings appetizer, which had 6 dumplings served with yummy dipping sweet sauce. The dumplings are flavorful and they have steamed pork inside.  For lunch entree I ordered the salmon teriyaki which was a generous portion. They serve it with stir fried vegetables and a scoop of rice with a nice salmon steak.  I found the flavors wonderful and just the right combination of sweetness and salty teriyaki. I hear good things about their sushi so will try it in the future. They were busy with lunch but had good service. Parking is very busy so I parked in the Waverly deck (by the Hilton) and walked to the restaurant.

Dtups462W2UcJ9YHJ_s8ew.text: Attended the soft opening (not friend or family-as stated by another yelper)  on Sat.  night and was more than pleasantly surprised by the quality of the offerings, the cleanliness and wonderful service. The food presentations here are the best in the area for sushi, sashimi, urchin, etc. The sushi was so fresh and compares to some of the best sushi places.   Yes, it is in the new busy Waverly location on Providence but the wait and parking were not bad at all. Small bar area to spend time and get a bowl of their yummy edamame to share.   Casual, trendy, and takes reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

3OSRL3uRcccSU6dQIXbxOA.text: This is our favorite go to sushi place since settling in Charlotte compared to NY.  Can't believe that I waited this long to write a review.   We love the staff and fresh sushi and sake variety here.   For those  adventurous type, highly recommend sitting by sushi bar and letting the sushi chef Robin and manager Q and the wait staff just give you suggestions to try.  You will not be disappointed. The variety of fresh sushi is amazing.    Love, love, love this place !   Recommendation to the owner try a sampler menu pairing of your sushi and sake - we will be first to sign up!

Y72FAu_g9tNzHiVzskBUkQ.text: Had a great dinner. We had Brandon as the waiter and he was awesome. His recommendations we're the best. The drinks were weak, they had a manager from Baku as bar tender and he didn't really know how to make a specialty cocktail.

nlRB-jYSiKlbytDvijcd1w.text: Yum yum and yum. Always delicious and expertly made sushi. Wait staff is fast, polite and knowledgeable, always offering helpful suggestions. The restaurant has a cool vibe and is ultra clean. A fav!

nJFi4cQGEkBFqw47tehukA.text: Compared to the South Park location, this space is brighter and more contemporary and frankly, much more fun.  I love the open concept and all the textures on the floor, walls, seating, etc.    The Teriyaki chicken dish that I had was a generous portion and tasty. Our server was very attentive and we liked his personality.  The only thing that was frustrating was when my dish came out about ten minutes before my lunch companion's did. This is always awkward.  Even though she said, "ah go ahead and don't wait for me", it still feels really weird and rude being the only one eating.  At the same time, you realize that your food is getting COLD.  It's the restaurant's job to make sure dishes are better timed and come out together.   Otherwise, a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Check out the textures!
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. My entree

WgrDb6Whvv5Q00MLsu0OmQ.text: I can't recommend this place high enough - my favorite restaurant.   I want to be perfectly clear - fantastic! I like nagiri and I eat it once a week, usually for lunch at Nikko (which is great), this place is better. If you've read my reviews you know I consider eating at a place like voting - by supporting it you are voting that they continue to do it the way that they are and that they may stay in business.   I really want this place to continue doing exactly what they are doing. It's a big deal to have this good of sushi so close to home.

phWD8WBU9EvY_i-x9YyZhg.text: We visited at 9:15pm on a Tuesday during the soft opening. It was a quiet night and we were seated and served promptly. Brandon had excellent recommendations for both drinks and sushi. Our rolls were extraordinary, and we would venture to say they might be our current favorite in Charlotte. We ordered the Snow, Niigata (sp?), and Ballantyne rolls. We had a hard time determining which was our top choice of the three, and we would absolutely order all three again. It's very obvious their ingredients are fresh and quality driven. Along with the amazing sushi, the atmosphere is cozy and chic.   We will absolutely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

U9WRR46cBEOmRx-_mzRdog.text: Loved the sushi here! My sister-in-law doesn't do raw sushi so the crunchy roll was perfect for her. I got the Niigata which was definitely hot with those jalapenos on top! I would get it again and will hopefully be back to this awesome sushi spot again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top: crunchy roll Lower: Niigata roll Appetizer: edamame

tDzdJOecoNjYfZb5IjNZjg.text: Just moved here. Needed a sushi place. I FOUND IT! Yama is it.   Let's break it down:  1) appetizers  - Ka raage - best I've had in a while   - Gyoza - pan crisp bottom and perfectly cooked noodle top  - edamame - they use the good salt   - calamari - perfectly cooked and fresh   2) Specialty Roll and Sashimi  - Magic Roll - crunchy interior and melt in your mouth avocado and top  - Ballantyne - My new favorite - Lobster Roll - I'm not a fan of the Seaweed on the inside of the Roll, so this was good, but not great for me  4) side  -fried Brussels - delicious! Fried to perfection. Tasted like candy.

AY3xk_rqvI5W17mRAg4DMw.text: This is a great location and the interior design is aesthetic and amazing. The floors are really nicely done and the table spacing and layout is wonderful. Add to this, some nice windows and lots of light.  We found the prices to be on the high side. Selection was modest, certainly not extensive. Portions are average, perhaps on the small side. The miso soup was so-so. The gyoza was perfect (but half-size portion).  Main course, sushi - disappointing. Fake crab and rice tasted stale. Definitely not mouth watering. I thought maybe we found "the place" for sushi...nope, another let-down.  Will repeat, but expect the bill to be higher to get normal dinner-size portions.

WaiapHYxExNlx9LNrcBOgA.text: A wonderful Asian restaurant that will be around a long time. The food was very good and the cost was less than one would expect in such a high end Asian restaurant. We will be back for more.

xwhk3TXRVT9NpwMN7f_HSg.text: My favorite sushi spot in Charlotte. Always fresh and unique selections daily. Staff is exceptional.

V2uTCfMykmNLEd_uQNOVeA.text: We really love their sushi and service. They have a great bar and awesome atmosphere. This is one of our favorite places to get sushi.

tbhRLJ5hzbzZwoeHaJxDpQ.text: Hands down the best sushi in the Charlotte area! This is my third time here. First time that I ate at the bar with friends. It was a busy Saturday night on a holiday weekend. The bartender was excellent with his recommendations (on the sushi) and made sure our drinks were topped off. My friends and I absolutely enjoyed the food and drinks but the ambiance was just as wonderful!

QFAK0p-5raOJS4dc_Hv6Rw.text: We frequent Yama and love the fresh offerings along with the wonderful staff!   We usually start with a ginger salad, miso soup or Brussel sprouts.  Sashimi selections are always super fresh and interesting.  Especially if you let them know your palate preferences and allow them to be creative.  We like The Waverly,  the Morrison,  the Ballantyne rolls- we've tried them all!  You can also ask them to fix a few specialty rolls that are not on the menu.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Robin with blue fin tuna that just arrived

8giALBF4P0C8D5VqI5NYfQ.text: I've been coming here for awhile now and figured I should really write a review. The sushi here is some of the best, and I don't just mean for Charlotte. IMHO, this place competes with sushiyas in Hawaii, and is better than most of the places I've been to in LA, SF and Manhattan. Also, the miso soup is exceptional; you can really tell that they care about their dashi. My family says their cooked food and rolls are excellent too, but I go straight for the nigiri every time because Robin is the master. Always ask about their specials, and make sure you get the kinmedai whenever it's available. My other favorites are hirame (get it with the shiso leaf) and ikura (the lemon zest takes it to a whole new level).  The space is very clean and comfortable, and every member of the staff is super friendly and attentive. Hands down my favorite Charlotte restaurant.

VNumDCQQxBvMTvdayDb8Lw.text: Enjoyed a day of shopping at Waverly, then decided to check out Yama for a late lunch.  First of all, this place isn't very big, but airy and spacious, thanks to its super-high ceilings...and a bright, light brown wooden motif. The place is also very well air conditioned (always a big plus in my book!); and provides cool, metro-chic overhead music. I've looked into Yama at SouthPark location, and I definitely prefer the modern decor and the lofty layout at this location.  The menu is typical of most Japanese restaurant, featuring the most popular Japanese staples. I noticed that they also specialized in a variety of "Hand Rolls", and offered several tantalizing desserts. I ordered the "Waverly Roll", along with an order of Tori Kara-age (AKA Fried Popcorn Chicken)...and both were Dee-Lish! From looking at Yelp pictures of their various sushi rolls, I didn't expect too much creativity... but regardless, their foods were well presented, in chic, upscaled tablewares.   Lastly, the service was spot on. Granted, there weren't many diners in the off hours (2-3 pm) I was there, but the waiter was friendly and attentive, and everything hit my table in a timely fashion.  Overall, I really liked what this place had to offer...both casual, yet chic at the same time, with a great variety of Japanese foods in a convenient location. Think I found a new favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top: Tori Kara-age Bottom: &#34;Waverly Roll&#34;

itbakd6TDaAEihnAzizYTQ.text: Yum! There are so many options for food in Waverly, but Yama is definitely a great choice. Great drinks, great appetizers, and great sushi.  I had the Mandarin Mule, which was delicious and a very sweet take on a mule. Some spring rolls that were pretty standard. And the Morrison roll. The steak on top of the sushi was very good.  Overall not my favorite sushi place in Charlotte, but definitely one I would return to.

7cLuRMEBFcUgiKNOKOXAOw.text: Love the decor in here!   Very cool industrial vibe. Good service.  A few things to improve on tho. We were a little mixed on the food.  We had the kalbi rib app - it had a yummy teriyaki glaze but the meat was super chewy and very hard to bite thru esp without a knife.   The popcorn chicken was a decent portion and very crispy.  Sauce that came with was a good complement.   I wish there were more sushi rolls to choose from on the menu like many other places do - several don't even include raw fish (literally half).   We had the niigata, naughty akami, and waverly.  All were just fine - didn't knock our socks off. Wish there was more texture - all the same flavor.   Also had the sashimi platter- very fresh and tender fish.  Lastly, they have a reso system on their website which is great but they do not take same day reso so I guess you have to plan ahead.  The hostess was a bit cold -  smiling a bit in the hospitality business would go along way.  Not opposed to going back, but not at the top of the list.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top to bottom - waverly, niigata, naughty akami
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sashimi platter - 15 pieces for $30.  Very fresh

iU9PKtELA771AUjrnNyZVw.text: Yama is interesting... The food was pretty good. We ordered the gyoza pork dumplings as an appetizer, which were very good. As our main dishes we ordered the teriyaki chicken and the teriyaki steak. The main dishes were a bit bland in flavor, but still good. It was freezing cold in there, making it difficult to enjoy ourselves since we were dressed for the 95 degree weather. Our server was actually wearing a sweater in July. Unfortunately, the cold room temperature also caused our food to cool quickly, resulting in the last third of our meal being cold. If it would have been a proper temperature in there, then I would have given Yama 4 stars based on the food.

xf4Jw9ViV8eb32qXoyr0nw.text: I came here for lunch with a few co-workers. This place is amazing! The sushi is so fresh and delicious. I got the lunch special with a bento box. They have great lunch specials that everyone would enjoy. The prices aren't bad for lunch either. We also got calamari for the table which was amazing! It is a small place so I can see there being a wait if it gets crowded. The service was great. Our waiter came over to the table a few times to check on us and was helpful when needed. I would go back here for lunch, the dinner prices were a little high.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box

UgXNXJapSvx81t3rvN492w.text: Decent food, SLOW SERVICE! Went for lunch and only 5 tables were occupied in the restaurant and it still took so long to get my food. I only ordered 2 sushi rolls. I asked the waiter for lunch specials and he said there were none. I then turn to the back of the menu after I already order and there are lunch specials...   My food was ready and just sitting at the sushi bar while he chatted with his coworkers. My waiter couldn't care less about serving his customers. There are not many sushi places in the area and I probably wouldn't go back.

xJRWoEd-YvsgclwcGbWKJw.text: Very decent Japanese restaurant - if a tad on the pricey side. Sushi is good, both the rolls and the nigiri. Appetizers are great, especially the gyoza. Teriyaki, tempura, noodles, etc all worth your time.

JJQxf0_i4-R-fKhF9yW7lg.text: I've been dying to check out this spot since it opened and just needed a girls' night to do so.   We were seated so quickly for a Friday night during the Christmas holiday that I was almost scared! But those fears were quickly eased with the first cocktail. Although small, the cocktail menu had a few good suggestions. Definitely try their signature ones.   We started with calamari which was very good. I love calamari rings so I don't have to pick through an appetizer to find them.    I'd read rave reviews about the Crunchy to. And OMG was it delicious....so much so that I had the waiter bring a second one.   Only tip... avoid the tables next to the bar. I felt like bar patrons were infringing on our space.

OwWIx1pN-JoTJcUikCJOlw.text: I've been to a lot of sushi spots, NYC to San Francisco and more, and have been looking for my fix in Charlotte. I'm finished looking!! Yama in Waverly has got some of the freshest and fantastic varieties of fish we've ever had! Robin is behind the counter and prepares some of the best concoctions of sushi / sashimi that we've had to date! The staff has made us feel like family over the course of the past two years!  Incredibly knowledgeable and don't get me started on the Saki selection! Unreal!! Simply our favorite place for our fish fix in Charlotte .... PERIOD!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buri

KJAO2PRhtZ-f3iZHlt5lDw.text: I was in Charlotte visiting with friends and we went here for dinner. Our server was friendly and prompt, without being overbearing. We had calamari and shrimp shumai for appetizers, and they were both really good. I had a ginger salad and the snow roll. It was a great sushi roll but I wish I had gotten something else as well. I didn't leave hungry by any means, but I should've ordered some veggies or something on the side. A couple people in our party had hibachi shrimp, steak, and chicken. It all looked delicious. I wouldn't mind checking it out again next time I'm in Charlotte.

a7OccMDEdrJftinxysPIXA.text: Best Japanese restaurant in the area.  Great Sushi, and tempura.  Lunch specials are a real treat on a budget.

hCFW4peaSpp2LTaOQgqAxw.text: Be warned ...Yama closes 15 minutes before what the hours state on the door. I walked in on a Wednesday at 9:43 to be told they already closed at 9:45.  Hmmmm. I think they should change hours listed on Door.

IXp-eSIM-HYmQ6LH63G4nw.text: Delicious fresh fish, nigiri was awesome, and so was the rolls. Great service and quick.

bOqLdo_xI4a9_oy23UyRaA.text: This is what you call really fancy sushi & it is GOOD, but be prepared to pay a fancy price. They got sushi rolls topped with filet mignon, they got lobster rolls topped with expensive caviar, they serve Otoro both sashimi and nigiri style at $18 a pop, etc. All of our food was exceptional. The only thing they could improve on was service. Appetizers took way too long to come out and the place was practically empty. Entrees came out a little all over the place. Refills on drinks was great though. Our bill for 5 came out to 270 buckaroos! YIKES! But it was some of the best sushi we've eaten!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Morrison Roll - that filet!
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Roll
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Otoro Nigiri - all $54 of it

v_pJYjYLqpZzU83qwCNsyQ.text: We loooooooooooove the sushi at Yama. Seriously, at night I dream of it. Try anything, but we love the lobster roll, all the sashimi, the calamari, and the fried rice is also super delish. If we could get them to serve rose by the glass, it's likely I would just move in.

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

Q5f3H_wNQ_vUcWUGItlV6A.text: So excited that the Yama Waverly finally opened.   The only take thing I could think to complain about is the parking. It is not great but once inside you'll quickly forget that as you indulge yourself in their delicious food.  I tried the Miso Soul and crunchy roll both were delicious. The miso soup had sea weed, tofu, mushrooms and onions . It was so good and the crunchy roll featured shrimp tempura and crab, both made this roll so delicious.  It is everything I knew it would be.  Be warned. I will no doubt be "checking in " here a lot .   Love Yama . Two thumbs way up

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crunchy roll
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Miso soup
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining area

k6VoFtafWEqygsa8NV9XWg.text: Back to one of my favs: Yama, Waverly. My friends first time.  As always, started with the cold appies: seaweed salad & James Island tuna & avocado "salad". Yum! He loved each, but combined it's heaven. Sweet & tart lemon drop martini livened my palate! Dinner: He had the Yaki Udon with chicken. Stirred fried udon noodles, napa cabbage, shiitake mushroom, onion, carrot & spring onion. Generous portion with good ratio of protein, ingredients were very fresh & flavorful. I had the Grilled maple leaf farm duck breast w. steamed white rice. A beautiful display, however ... I forgot to order it medium & it came well done. Which made it tough and dry. Thankfully there was some seaweed salad to moisten it up a bit. Our server, Jennifer, was peppy and accommodating. Just wish she asked how I'd like my duck prepared. But the fact she brought extra silverware & laid it on napkins not the table made huge points w.this semi-germaphobe!

photos.caption: Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Yama - Charlotte, NC, United States

FaClflvl_jFgA04-_d3kMg.text: Very fresh seafood.  Really sweet hostess coverage.  Sushi is fantastic; however the rolls seem pretty small or it's so good you just want more.  Will definitely return super convenient location for sushi in the Ballantyne/Providence area.

2HUov_hwB-MtayZ1xYUqmQ.text: This was our first visit. At eight pm it was still very busy. The front greeters were polite and responsive. The dress is casual and the ambiance was nice. We sat at the sushi bar. Our server was nice but she was marginally attentive (this may be because it was very busy). The menu had a great food selection along with the beer and the sake selection. We chose from the sushi section. The food was excellent. The price is above average bit worth the food served. I would have given it 5 stars but the service lacked. If it wasn't for the Manger "Que" I don't think we would have been served as fast.

J45hM-dhjNOfO_AxbSWgFA.text: Great atmosphere, modern, clean. Food was really good. Taste fresh.  Friendly staff. Greeted with smiles.

6M5-z8Aj_OU-n7UIAcC5Cg.text: Amazing restaurant. I tried their famous Waverly roll with their fried rice and tempura shrimp appetizer and I was very delighted. I was full for the rest of the night and the taste was amazing. The service was outstanding, the owner even took the time to explain the menu for me and recommended the best things I should order. Cant wait to come back for a second round.

7LnApY84D8LoEoFrHR_azQ.text: Must come place.  Great atmosphere, friendly staff. Fresh sashimi. One of my favorite japanese restaurant?

gQcgq8Yln5Uch6_k_oZsVw.text: Fabulous sushi. Fun, contemporary interior at Waverly location with great cocktail menu. Waverly, Morrison and Ballantyne rolls are amazing!

76tfkXrSYuNH0vSXhQAKaQ.text: The best sushi in Sourh Charlotte!  Great prompt service. Charlie was the best!!  Kiddos!  We'll be back!  Thanks for making my birthday special!

UgYkXPByZ2m7g5NUN7E2oQ.text: The fish was very fresh, however the rolls that we ordered were literally about an inch in diameter, with a sliver of fish inside. At $12 and $14 a piece, I expected a bit more. That in itself will prevent me from coming back.

P-GtOYpJhVshuxkn6ozWeg.text: Overall, Yama has very mediocre food for a steep price. The sushi rolls are tiny, and the quality is just on par with any other typical sushi bar. This restaurant seems to be significantly more focused on aesthetics and ambience than the actual food. Service is also painfully slow - I received my meal a full 15 minutes before my friend received hers (and this is after waiting for nearly 30 minutes for a single sushi roll and three pieces of sashimi). The food wasn't bad, but it's not worth the price in my opinion.

_m5wXLg0nefGwVBL-z-vnA.text: We were here during their soft opening, and overall we did not feel the food warranted the price. We primarily ordered hot, cooked foods because we had sashimi the previous night. Items ordered: Gyoza, edamame, calamari, popcorn chicken, Brussels sprouts, miso soup, clam soup, yaki udon and snow roll. The udon was very bland and reminded me of Chinese takeout. The miso soup also bordered on bland, but would prefer that over being overly salty which many restaurants tend to do. My husband said the roll was okay and noted the sashimi we had the previous night was much fresher (clean catch's sashimi grade fish). However, my husband is pretty critical when it comes to sushi and sashimi! The calamari was cooked tempura style and it was a little too much of the fried/grease taste and too little of the calamari. Our favorites of the meal were the edamame (kids loved), Brussels sprouts and clam soup.  Service: our server was attentive, friendly and knew the menu well. The food came out quickly and was warm on arrival.  Verdict: We probably won't be back and will opt for Musashi for Japanese food.

KphsFZCODU2VAYtaWxmFpA.text: We really enjoyed Yama. The food was very good and the atmosphere was fun. The bar is also fully stocked so you can get fun cocktails.

L068_lmKdEAy8r12T_S0QA.text: Found this place late at night when we were craving for sushi. Got sat immediately for a big party in the PDR, and we got the best service! SERIOUSLY!! We tried many dishes and I was surprised this place served duck! It's phenomenal! They are also doing limited rare fishes and the live uni is urching-good(sea-urchin)! Will definitely come back here!

mtFl_r0a7f_HFWXIjE6yzw.text: Finally a great Japanese restaurant in the area!!  The atmosphere was great, good service and delicious food.  I got the tempura bento box for lunch and couldn't finish it all.  The miso soup had these yummy mushrooms in it.  My DH did a chicken rice dish and enjoyed it too.  We will be back!!

iBBBZzhmCoOwaz2aAwIROw.text: Great restaurant in Waverly! Amazing service, food is awesome! We had he salmon teriyaki, the snow roll, and the grilled duck. Everything was outstanding! Overall atmosphere is great. Would highly recommend!!

ATpNtRK-RsecHwQr3gEGFQ.text: This is the Best Sushi in town if not anywhere.  Q runs a great place.  Awesome sushi 5 star service in a cool hip atmosphere.  Great outdoor seating area and great place to chill, have a drink relax with great food. Favorite place to eat and hang out with friends or family.

rrD0GesERlD9QdDvgHvIvQ.text: We recently went here for dinner and sat at the sushi bar. The sushi was really good and some of the best I've had in Charlotte in quite awhile. I will definitely be back in the near future!

pQuq2CbEhdEtY28I9HXL-A.text: So me and my family went to this yama at waverly place because its a brand new open and we really wanna try it and we did. We use to went to their other location at south park but we still wanna go and try at the waverly location anyway. The food was amazing as usual. I love the sea bass.The taste was beyond amazing. My family actually order of 3 orders of those, ofcourse! The bento box was a good price yet it can actually fill you up especially on the straving day from work. I love everything about their taste. They got their own difference taste but when you combine them all together, it become super delicious.! Yummm!

_FqIzM-K8MXbqFeMyNDcJg.text: Decided to try Yama for date night and definitely was a great choice! The restaurant was alittle packed and had a wait time of 45 mins. but they got us a table in about 20 mins. The server was awesome, he was able to recommend certain dishes and give his opinion on others. All in all we received great service and definitely will be back!

NzBHEA_5f-DwnrJf-8c98A.text: Sushi was good but not the best we've had in the area. Especially considering the price point.  We sat at the sushi bar and honestly staring at the fish cut up in takeout trays with saturated paper towels on the bottom was a little unappetizing. It looked like a mess. My biggest complaint was the noise. Felt more like a crowded bar than a nice restaurant.

Z7VAoE84XzHlCCnOYlsMjQ.text: Our family loved Yuma at south park location and always wish they could open another one close to my house. NOW IT COMES to Waverly. My family and I are so excited. We went there during the family and friend soft opening. The decor, colors, setup and ambience are all light and refreshing. They offer a full selection of Japanese delicacies at very reasonable prices. LOVE their outstanding fresh sushi here, they are the freshest sushi we could find in Charlotte. We were also ordered a beef dish (Appetizer) Kalbi it was so tender and bursting with flavor, it had us understanding why not everyone in the place was ordering sushi. The service is great from the moment of entrance to the moment of exit. Everyone is friendly. Our favorite sushi place, highly recommend YUMA to my families and friends.
